Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2010 07:13PM psp2pdx wrote: I  got sick on dose dense AC and ended up in the hospital with neutropenic fever.  I kept thinking I would get better each day but instead got sicker and more dehydrated.  DON'T mess around with fever.  Call your oncologist and put the ball in their court.   Hope you are feeling better soon.
Posts.Title: getting a cold right after chemo chk8 psp2pdx

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2008 10:21PM psp2pdx wrote: Better to have it removed. The cluster is most likely calcifications. Susan Love M.D. has a book out. The Breast Bible I call it. Really gives easy to understand information. Answers questions in layman terms-not medical so you have to look up every other word. Make sure you ask for your 'tumor' profile. ER/PR/Her2Neu status. You can also ask for KI63 and Topo II and VEGFR. If it is cancerous that will help the Dr. know what chemotherapy drugs are best. Read up on it and you will feel better and informed. I am doing well. 2 years since my dx. Not sure what age group you are in but I was triple neg. good luck hope this helped with info. psp2pdx
Posts.Title: steriotactic biopsy results CCookie brst26

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2008 12:00AM psp2pdx wrote: I had sentinel node bx at time of surgery. Only the 'hot nodes' or ones that lit up were taken out which ended up to be two. They were neg. I haven't had problems with lymphedema. My friend ended up just three months later with the same dx (triple neg idc) same surgeon they removed 18 nodes. all were neg. go figure.......the good news 1 1/2 years out she doesn't have lymphedema either. u have to be careful not get cuts, cat scratches, rose thorns etc. also having your nails done w/o using your own equipment puts u at risk also think the exercises may be important after surgery i found the surgery (segmental wedge resection) fairly easy-childbirth was harder!! good luck diane
Posts.Title: steriotactic biopsy results CCookie brst26

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2008 07:11PM psp2pdx wrote: Chisame next time you have test run you can ask your Dr. to put on the sheet 'fax copy to' and give a fax number. Also it is important to keep you own medical record file. Get copies of each mammo/ct/mri. They now put them on discs. if you don't have one maybe a close friend does. It is so not fair to not give you a heads up. I would let your M.D. know you have suffered from the length of time and information. If they could on;y understand that the anxiety that builds really sets you back mentally, spiritually and emotionally.. I wish the best for you.........been there Diane
